Opportunity to Interview at Microsoft - Vancouver BC

Hi Brian, 

Would you have any interest in interviewing at Microsoft? I know you're probably busy, so we've come up with an expedited interview process. On Friday, July 14th, we will be hosting an interview session to hire multiple Software Engineers at different levels of seniority Microsoft's Movies & TV Team at our Vancouver, BC location. Some of the best parts of this process are that you are evaluated individually and they often make offers to upwards of 50% of the candidates that interview. You will know if you have an offer the business day following your interview!

Basic Qualifications:
- Computer Science, Engineering, or other technical degree
- At least 2-8 years’ experience writing code with C++ or C# (Java also acceptable)
- Applied knowledge of digital media application development and related formats
- Canadian Work Authorization or able to obtain a TN Visa

If interested, please reply to me and I'll let you know how to quickly register. If it's not the right fit or the right time, maybe you would be interested in looking at other options.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. I’m looking forward to hearing from you!

Best regards,

Joe Pierce
Microsoft

Joe Pierce
Technical Recruiter at Microsoft
v-josepi@microsoft.com

HI Brian,



Thank you for your concern, but I’m not sure what you’re referring to as 
far as a scam. Microsoft setting up travel and accommodations, and 
reimbursing for qualified expenses (meals, transportation, etc.)? I have a 
Microsoft e-mail address, so probably wouldn’t be here long if I was 
scamming. J



Here’s a brief overview of our events if this helps. 

1. You would need to register and apply for the event.
2. We will review your application and set up a 15-20 minute time to go
over the details.
3. You’ll need to take our Online Technical Screen (OTS). The OTS is a
coding assessment that you would need to take on your own time. It
consists of 2-3 coding problems that you will need to complete in C,
C++, C# or Java (whichever is your strongest language) within a 60
minute timeframe.
4. Pass the OTS and we'll invite you in to interview day with the team
in Vancouver! It consists of a total of four 1:1 technical
interviews that last 45 minutes each. 
5. You'll find out if you have an offer on the following business day 



We will also fly you in, provide accommodations, and reimburse other 
qualified expenses such as meals and transportation. 





Joe Pierce

Microsoft Engineering Talent Acquisition

HI Brian,



Splashthat is the event management site we use. The only real personal 
information it collects is what’s already on your resume. No different 
than LinkedIn or any job board. WDG (wdgvancouver.splashthat.com) is the 
acronym for Windows and Devices Group which is the parent division of the 
Movies & TV Team. If you want to sign up, please feel free. 



Thank you,
